alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 8:13PM CST until February 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Missouri... St. Francis River near Patterson. .Recent heavy rainfall of 2 to 3 inches over the past 24 hours has caused river levels to rapidly rise along the St Francis River. The river is forecast to potentially reach flood stage at 16 feet this evening. For the St. Francis River...including Patterson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Francis River near Patterson. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet just after midnight tonight, then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
